entries.text:
Distinctively shaped helm worn by the Knights of Catarina.
Outside Catarina, it is often ridiculed for its onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying.

Distinctively shaped armor worn by the Knights of Catarina.
Outside Catarina, it is often ridiculed for its onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying.

Distinctively shaped gauntlets worn by the Knights of Catarina.
Outside Catarina, they are often ridiculed for their onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying.

Distinctively shaped leggings worn by the Knights of Catarina.
Outside Catarina, they are often ridiculed for their onion-like shape, infuriating the proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for parrying.

Helm of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.
Long ago, the Way of White produced its first Undead, a paladin in golden armor. With the legendary treasures Grant and Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran, Land of the Gods, in the first Undead mission of the Way of White.

Armor of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.
Long ago, the Way of White produced its first Undead, a paladin in golden armor. With the legendary treasures Grant and Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran, Land of the Gods, in the first Undead mission of the Way of White.

Gauntlets of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.
Long ago, the Way of White produced its first Undead, a paladin in golden armor. With the legendary treasures Grant and Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran, Land of the Gods, in the first Undead mission of the Way of White.

Leggings of Leeroy, Paladin of the Catacombs.
Long ago, the Way of White produced its first Undead, a paladin in golden armor. With the legendary treasures Grant and Sanctus, Leeroy set out for Lordran, Land of the Gods, in the first Undead mission of the Way of White.

Mask of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.
Some say the skeletal mask of an ancient Darkwraith is partially fused with the flesh of its face.

Armor of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.
Their armor transformed, and remains a symbol of the Dark servants and their diabolical art of Lifedrain.

Gauntlets of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.
Their gauntlets transformed, and remain symbol of the Dark servants and their diabolical art of Lifedrain.

Leggings of the Darkwraiths, former knights of New Londo who descended into Dark.
Their leggings transformed, and remain a symbol of the Dark servants and their diabolical art of Lifedrain.

Hood worn by the brigands who raid mountain hamlets and attack travelers.
In addition to protecting against the blazing sun, dust, and sand, it helps them tell friend from foe in the heat of battle.

Armor worn by the brigands who raid mountain hamlets and attack travelers.
The addition of metal over a base of cloth and leather offers good mobility and defense.

Gauntlets worn by the brigands who raid mountain hamlets and attack travelers.
The addition of metal over a base of cloth and leather offers good mobility and defense.

Trousers worn by the brigands who raid mountain hamlets and attack travelers.
The addition of metal over a base of cloth and leather offers good mobility and defense.

Black cloth mask worn by spooks from an Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder their unique form of martial arts.
While it sacrifices defense for the sake of greater mobility, it does offer resistance to bleeding and poison among other things, perhaps due to the nature of their duties.

Black cloth garb worn by spooks from an Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder their unique form of martial arts.
While it sacrifices defense for the sake of greater mobility, it does offer resistance to bleeding and poison among other things, perhaps due to the nature of espionage.

Black cloth gauntlets worn by spooks from an Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder their unique form of martial arts.
While they sacrifice defense for the sake of greater mobility, they do offer resistance to bleeding and poison among other things, perhaps due to the nature of espionage.

Black cloth leggings worn by spooks from an Eastern land. Designed so as not to hinder their unique form of martial arts.
While they sacrifice defense for the sake of greater mobility, they do offer resistance to bleeding and poison among other things, perhaps due to the nature of espionage.

Helm of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight known for his great strength.
Built of a special black iron and providing strong defense, notably against fire, but so terribly heavy to be unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

Armor of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight known for his great strength.
Built of a special black iron and providing strong defense, notably against fire, but so terribly heavy to be unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

Gauntlets of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight known for his great strength.
Built of a special black iron and providing strong defense, notably against fire, but so terribly heavy to be unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.

Leggings of Black Iron Tarkus, a knight known for his great strength.
Built of a special black iron and providing strong defense, notably against fire, but so terribly heavy to be unwieldy to all but Tarkus himself.
Helm of Smough, the Executioner, protector of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor Londo. It offers extremely high defense and can be worn by humans, but not without great difficulty.
Armor of Smough, the Executioner, protector of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor Londo. It offers extremely high defense and can be worn by humans, but not without great difficulty.
Gauntlets of Smough, the Executioner, protector of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor Londo. It offers extremely high defense and can be worn by humans, but not without great difficulty.
Leggings of Smough, the Executioner, protector of the cathedral at the forsaken city of Anor Londo. It offers extremely high defense and can be worn by humans, but not without great difficulty.

Helm of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve Seath the Scaleless. The six eyes arranged in two vertical columns compensate for Seath's lack of sight.
The heaviest of protective gear for sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

Robe of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve Seath the Scaleless. Even after the onset of Seath's madness, the "snatchers," as they were often called, ventured to far lands to find suitable human specimens.
The heaviest of protective gear for sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

Gauntlets of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve Seath the Scaleless. Even after the onset of Seath's madness, the "snatchers," as they were often called, ventured to far lands to find suitable human specimens.
The heaviest of protective gear for sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

Waistcloth of the Channelers, sorcerers that serve Seath the Scaleless. Even after the onset of Seath's madness, the "snatchers," as they were often called, ventured to far lands to find suitable human specimens.
The heaviest of protective gear for sorcerers, and imbued with magic.

Helm of Lautrec the Embraced, representing the goddess Fina's love.
During his solitude, he forsook everything, for he believed in the goddess's love for him.

Armor of Lautrec the Embraced, representing the goddess Fina's love.
The goddess's arms wrap around it, as if to embrace the wearer.

Gauntlets of Lautrec the Embraced, representing the goddess Fina's love.
During his solitude, he forsook everything, for he believed in the goddess's love for him.

Leggings of Lautrec the Embraced, representing the goddess Fina's love.
During his solitude, he forsook everything, for he believed in the goddess's love for him.

A strange helm from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.
The two horns are believed to symbolize wisdom.

Strange armor from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.
The many medals are believed to symbolize glory.

Strange gauntlets from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.
The gold bracelets symbolize a vanquisher.

Strange boots from the ancient land of Zena, birthplace of the curious dealer Domhnall.
The inlaid silver rings symbolize an explorer.

Moss-covered helm of the Stone Knight, defender of the Darkroot Garden.
The Stone Knight is a product of ancient magic, and although this helm is also imbued with magic, it is incredibly heavy.

Moss-covered armor of the Stone Knight, defender of the Darkroot Garden.
The Stone Knight is a product of ancient magic, and although this armor is also imbued with magic, it is incredibly heavy.

Moss-covered gauntlets of the Stone Knight, defender of the Darkroot Garden.
The Stone Knight is a product of ancient magic, and although these gauntlets are also imbued with magic, they are incredibly heavy.

Moss-covered leggings of the Stone Knight, defender of the Darkroot Garden.
The Stone Knight is a product of ancient magic, and although these leggings are also imbued with magic, they are incredible heavy.

Helm worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.
The crystal provides powerful defense, but it cannot be used for long because it is easily broken and cannot be repaired.

Armor worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.
The crystal provides powerful defense, but it cannot be used for long because it is easily broken and cannot be repaired.

Gauntlets worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.
The crystal provides strong defense, but they cannot be used for long because they are easily broken and cannot be repaired.

Leggings worn by a Hollowed knight, who was partially crystallized.
The crystal power provides good defense, but they cannot be used for long because they are easily broken and cannot be repaired.

Mask of the three ancient sorcerers reputed for sealing away an entire city against the corruption spilling from the abyss.
It symbolizes their resolve to keep the seal shut forever and their atonement for all who were sacrificed, but two of the three forsook their duty, stricken with guilt for the souls they damned.
The sealers were once healers, the bright crimson color of their robes is a symbol of that.

Robe of the three ancient sorcerers reputed for sealing away an entire city against the corruption spilling from the abyss.
The sealers were once healers, the bright crimson color of their robes is a symbol of that.

Gloves of the three ancient sorcerers reputed for sealing away an entire city against the corruption spilling from the abyss.
The sealers were once healers, the bright crimson color of their robes is a symbol of that.

Waistcloth of the three ancient sorcerers reputed for sealing away an entire city against the corruption spilling from the abyss.
The sealers were once healers, the bright crimson color of their robes is a symbol of that.

Mask worn by pardoners serving Velka, the Goddess of Sin.
The pardoners listen to the confessions of sinners, urging reflection and salvation. Their masks symbolize separation from worldly desires.

Robe worn by pardoners serving Velka, the Goddess of Sin.
The pardoners' attire is uniformly black in color and said to be imbued with Velka's mystical power, which provides resistance against all manner of magic.

Manchette worn by pardoners serving Velka, the Goddess of Sin.
The pardoners' attire is uniformly black in color and said to be imbued with Velka's mystical power, which provides resistance against all manner of magic.

Tights worn by pardoners serving Velka, the Goddess of Sin.
The pardoners' attire is uniformly black in color and said to be imbued with Velka's mystical power, which provides resistance against all manner of magic.

Helm of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight. Of high quality, but lacking any particular powers.
Solaire's incredible prowess must have come from rigorous training alone, for his equipment exhibits no special traits.

Armor of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight. The large holy symbol of the Sun, while powerless, was painted by Solaire himself.
Solaire's incredible prowess must have come from rigorous training alone, for his equipment exhibits no special traits.

Bracelets of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight. Of high quality, but lacking any particular powers.
Solaire's incredible prowess must have come from rigorous training alone, for his equipment exhibits no special traits.

Leggings of Solaire of Astora, Knight of Sunlight. Of high quality, but lacking any particular powers.
Solaire's incredible prowess must have come from rigorous training alone, for his equipment exhibits no special traits.

A chainmail helm of thin interlinking rings of steel. It is common throughout the human world since it can be easily produced, is not too heavy, and offers good defense.
Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive.

Chainmail armor of thin interlinking rings of steel. It is common throughout the human world since it can be easily produced, is not too heavy, and offers good defense.
Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive.
Gauntlets made of soft leather. One of the more common kinds of protective gear.

Chainmail leggings of thin interlinking rings of steel. It is common throughout the human world since it can be easily produced, is not too heavy, and offers good defense.
Knights may favor flashy armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, anything is fine as long as it keeps them alive.

Helm worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.
It is rather substantial in size and weight, making its wearer look even bigger than he actually is.

Armor worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.
It is rather substantial in size and weight, making its wearer look even bigger than he actually is.

Gauntlets worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.
They are rather substantial in size and weight, making its wearer look even bigger than he actually is.

Leggings worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.
They are rather substantial in size and weight, making its wearer look even bigger than he actually is.

A loathsome parasite that inhabits Lost Izalith. It is completely immobile, yet still lives.
When worn on the head, it emanates blinding light, which is why it is known as a Sunlight Maggot.

Helm of Kirk, Knight of Thorns and notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of thorns grows from its surface.
It is a fitting item for the murderous Kirk, for by simply wearing it and rolling, one can damage enemies.

Armor of Kirk, Knight of Thorns and notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of thorns grows from its surface.
It is a fitting item for the murderous Kirk, for by simply wearing it and rolling, one can damage enemies.

Gauntlets of Kirk, Knight of Thorns and notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of thorns grows from their surface.
They are fitting items for the murderous Kirk, for by simply wearing them and rolling, one can damage enemies.

Leggings of Kirk, Knight of Thorns and notorious member of the Darkwraiths. A dense patch of thorns grows from their surface.
They are fitting items for the murderous Kirk, for by simply wearing them and rolling, one can damage enemies.

A sturdy helm made of iron. Very common type of protective gear, it provides a sound level of defense.
It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other physical threats.
Armor made of thick leather. Very common type of protective gear, it provides a sound level of defense.
Gauntlets made of thick leather. Very common type of protective gear, they provide a sound level of defense.
Boots made of thick leather. Very common type of protective gear, they provide a sound level of defense.

Hat worn by proper sorcerers who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.
The majority take pride in having studied at the academy and look down on breaking the formal dress code established for sorcerers.

Cloak worn by proper sorcerers who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.
The majority take pride in having studied at the academy and look down on breaking the formal dress code established for sorcerers.

Gauntlets worn by proper sorcerers who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.
The majority take pride in having studied at the academy and look down on breaking the formal dress code established for sorcerers.

Boots worn by proper sorcerers who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.
The majority take pride in having studied at the academy and look down on breaking the formal dress code established for sorcerers.

Hood worn by pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Though it appears tattered, it is actually quite strong.
Their attire offers substantial protection against poison, fire, and other forces of nature out in the hinterlands where they were driven.

Robe worn by pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Though it appears tattered, it is actually quite strong.
Their attire offers substantial protection against poison, fire, and other forces of nature out in the hinterlands where they were driven.

Manchette worn by pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Though it appears tattered, it is actually quite strong.
Their attire offers substantial protection against poison, fire, and other forces of nature out in the hinterlands where they were driven.
Boots made of thick leather. The boots of the pyromancers are incredibly tough, on account of the rugged grasslands and treacherous swamps they must traverse. Their soles are nearly impenetrable.

Broad-brimmed hat favored by the archer hero Pharis.
Pharis was an accomplished archer, and though he was human, he ranked alongside Hawkeye Gough, one of the Four Knights of Lord Gwyn. His hat is universally popular among children.
Armor made of soft leather. Very common type of protective gear.
Gloves made of soft leather. Very common type of protective gear.
Boots made of soft leather. Very common type of protective gear.

Hood worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offers substantial protection versus magic.
They have guarded the Great Paintings of Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down through the generations, but the reason for doing so passed from all memory long ago.

Robe worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offers substantial protection versus magic.
They have guarded the Great Paintings of Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down through the generations, but the reason for doing so passed from all memory long ago.

Gloves worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offer substantial protection versus magic.
They have guarded the Great Paintings of Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down through the generations, but the reason for doing so passed from all memory long ago.

Waistcloth worn by the alabaster-clothed guardians of the paintings in Anor Londo. Offers substantial protection versus magic.
They have guarded the Great Paintings of Ariamis for ages, passing their duty down through the generations, but the reason for doing so passed from all memory long ago.

Helm of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo.
Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the Four Knights. His golden lion helm is imbued with the power of lightning and should provide good protection against it.

Armor of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo.
Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the Four Knights. His golden lion armor is imbued with the power of lightning and should provide good protection against it.

Gauntlets of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo.
Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the Four Knights. His golden lion gauntlets are imbued with the power of lightning and should provide good protection against it.

Leggings of the dragonslayer Ornstein, who guards the cathedral in the forsaken city of Anor Londo.
Ornstein is believed to be the captain of the Four Knights. His golden lion leggings are imbued with the power of lightning and should provide good protection against it.

A distinctive helm made in an Eastern land.
Exquisitely crafted, this helm offers excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.

Distinctive armor made in an Eastern Land.
Exquisitely crafted, this armor offers excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.

Distinctive gauntlets made in an Eastern land.
Exquisitely crafted, these gauntlets offer excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.

Distinctive leggings made in an Eastern land.
Exquisitely crafted, these leggings offer excellent defense, particularly versus slash attacks, which are one of the main threats in battles in the East.

A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one knows where it came from.
The crown bears high-quality cloth which is quite soft to the touch, but its bright yellow color stings the eyes, and it is clearly far too big.

A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one knows where it came from.
It may be tattered, but its bright yellow color still stings the eyes.

Mysterious items once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one knows where they came from.
They may be tattered, but their bright yellow color still stings the eyes.

A mysterious item once worn by the Xanthous King Jeremiah, the legendary exile. No one knows where it came from.
It may be tattered, but its bright yellow color still stings the eyes.
Mask of sinners. They hide their faces, stifle their voices and hide in the shadows. It does not provide much in the way of defense.

This armor made of smooth black leather is extremely quiet, a good thing for those who hide in the shadows.
The leather itself is thick, offering a decent level of protection.

These gloves made of smooth black leather are extremely quiet, good for those who hide in the shadows.
The leather itself is thick, offering a decent level of protection.

These boots made of smooth black leather are extremely quiet, good for those who hide in the shadows.
The leather itself is thick, offering a decent level of protection.

Distinctive hat worn only by Way of White priests in Thorolund.
It is simply meant to show their position within the hierarchy. It holds almost no meaning in the land of Lordran.

Robe donned by men of the cloth. Though plain to the eye, its hardy fabric repels rain and keeps the body warm.
Those dissatisfied with church teachings must test their faith by going on a spiritual journey. Such is the ritual self-purification of the Way of White.
Thick, sturdy gloves made for travelers on extended journeys.

Trousers donned by men of the cloth. Though plain to the eye, their hardy fabric repels rain and keeps the body warm.
Those dissatisfied with church teachings must test their faith by going on a spiritual journey. Such is the ritual self-purification of the Way of White.

Helm of the Black Knights who haunt Lordran.
The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he departed to link the Fire but they were burned to ashes in the newly kindled flame, wandering the world as disembodied spirits ever after.

Armor of the Black Knights who haunt Lordran.
The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he departed to link the Fire, but they were burned to ashes in the newly kindled flame, wandering the world as disembodied spirits ever after.

Gauntlets of the Black Knights who haunt Lordran.
The knights pursued Lord Gwyn when he departed to link the Fire, but they were burned to ashes in the newly kindled flame, wandering the world as disembodied spirits ever after.

Leggings of the Black Knights who haunt Lordran.
The knights followed Lord Gwyn when he departed to link the flame, but they were burned to ashes in the newly kindled fire, wandering the world as disembodied spirits ever after.

Special magic crown bestowed upon Dusk, Princess of Oolacile, upon her birth.
Its wearer is blessed by all manner of magic. This raises the power and effect of the wearer's magic, but damage suffered by magic attacks also rises.

A dress from the ancient fallen land of Oolacile. Its ivory-colored silk features elaborate embroidery and is imbued with ancient magic power.
One cannot expect any physical protection from this garment, as it was not meant to be worn in battle.

Gloves from the ancient fallen land of Oolacile. Their ivory-colored silk features elaborate embroidery and are imbued with ancient magic power.
One cannot expect any physical protection from these, as they were not meant to be worn in battle.

A skirt from the ancient fallen land of Oolacile. Its ivory-colored silk features elaborate embroidery and is imbued with ancient magic power.
One cannot expect any physical protection from this garment, as it was not meant to be worn in battle.

Hat of the rogue witch Beatrice.
Almost all magic users that employ a wand studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is one of the few exceptions. She braved the Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

Cloak of the rogue witch Beatrice.
Almost all magic users that employ catalysts studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is one of the few exceptions. She braved the Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

Gloves of the rogue witch Beatrice.
Almost all magic users that employ catalysts studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is one of the few exceptions. She braved the Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

Skirt of the rogue witch Beatrice.
Almost all magic users that employ catalysts studied at Dragon School, but Beatrice is one of the few exceptions. She braved the Abyss but did not live to tell of her ordeal.

Helm of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora.
Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.

Armor of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora, based on the fire-warding heraldic symbol on its blue surcoat.
Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.

Gauntlets of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora.
Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.

Leggings of a nameless knight, perhaps an elite knight of Astora.
Although he was loath to give up on his Undead mission, he perished at the Undead Asylum, and went Hollow.
Hood of an aimless traveler. Made from sturdy leather, it offers protection versus wind and rain.

Coat of an aimless traveler. Made from sturdy leather and quilting.
Battle comes with the territory when one wanders the land, and this coat provides a certain degree of protection.

Manchette of an aimless traveler.
Made from sturdy leather and protects the hands.

Boots of an aimless traveler.
Made from sturdy leather. A must-have for long journeys.

Hat worn by proper mage smiths who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.
Mage smiths learn their craft alongside sorcerers, but apply their sorcery to forging weapons with magic embers.

Coat worn by proper mage smiths who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.
Mage smiths learn their craft alongside sorcerers, but apply their sorcery to forging weapons with magic embers.

Gauntlets worn by proper mage smiths who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.
Mage smiths learn their craft alongside sorcerers, but apply their sorcery to forging weapons with magic embers.

Boots worn by proper mage smiths who studied at Vinheim Dragon School.
Mage smiths learn their craft alongside sorcerers, but apply their sorcery to forging weapons with magic embers.

Gigantic hat worn by the great sorcerer Logan. It completely hid his face, which led to his nickname "Big Hat."
Famously antisocial, Logan used it to block out noise and people's stares so he could focus on his own thoughts, but it does not possess any special magic powers.

Robe worn by Big Hat Logan. It is said to have been from his apprentice days at Dragon School, but it is so worn out, no one knows what it originally looked like.
Logan, who cared little for his appearance, no doubt ever bothered to change out of it.
Gloves worn by Big Hat Logan. They are indistinguishable from the ordinary kind worn by travelers.
Boots worn by Big Hat Logan. They are indistinguishable from the ordinary kind worn by travelers.
Helm of a lower-rank knight. Despite the thin metal used, the grooved texture gives it added protection.
Armor of a lower-rank knight. Despite the thin metal used, the grooved texture gives it added protection.
Gauntlets of a lower-rank knight. Despite the thin metal used, the grooved texture gives them added protection.
Leggings of a lower-rank knight. Despite the thin metal used, the grooved texture gives them added protection.

Blindfold Blindfold worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.
Fire Keepers once wore the hoods of maidens in ages past, but now wear these intricate blindfolds.

Blindfold worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.
It is thought to have once been the white robe of a maiden, but smoke and ashes from bonfires have darkened it over the years.

Blindfold worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.
They are thought to have once been the white gloves of a maiden, but smoke and ashes from bonfires have darkened them over the years.

Blindfold worn by the Fire Keeper at Firelink Shrine.
It is thought to have once been the white skirt of a maiden, but its true origin is lost in patches of blood. Perhaps its former wearer was maimed to prevent escape?

White hood worn by traveling maidens. It is part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.
It is soft and well-made, but does not offer much in the way of defense, making it ill- suited to use in battle.

White robe worn by traveling maidens. It is part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.
It is soft and well-made, but does not offer much in the way of defense, making it ill- suited to use in battle.

White gloves worn by traveling maidens. They are part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.
While soft and well-made, they do not offer much in the way of defense, making them ill-suited to use in battle.

White skirt worn by traveling maidens. It is part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.
It is soft and well-made, but does not offer much in the way of defense, making it ill- suited to use in battle.

Helm of the Silver Knights who protect Anor Londo.
When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire, his knights split into two groups. The Silver Knights remained in the forsaken capital in the service of their goddess.

Armor of the Silver Knights who protect Anor Londo.
When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire, his knights split into two groups. The Silver Knights remained in the forsaken capital in the service of their goddess.

Gauntlets of the Silver Knights who protect Anor Londo.
When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire, his knights split into two groups. The Silver Knights remained in the forsaken capital in the service of their goddess.

Leggings of the Silver Knights who protect Anor Londo.
When Lord Gwyn departed to link the Fire, his knights split into two groups. The Silver Knights remained in the forsaken capital in the service of their goddess.

Helm worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, its tremendous weight is matched only by the defense it provides.
Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

Armor worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, its tremendous weight is matched only by the defense it provides.
Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

Gauntlets worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, their tremendous weight is matched only by the defense they provide.
Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

Leggings worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, their tremendous weight is matched only by the defense they provide.
Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

Helm of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.
After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received this helm, which hides her hideous form and helps her hunt the guilty.

Armor of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.
After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received this armor, which hides her hideous form and helps her hunt the guilty.

Gauntlets of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.
After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received these gauntlets, which hide her hideous form and help her hunt the guilty.

Leggings of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.
After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received these leggings, which hide her hideous form and help her hunt the guilty.

Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.
She wore this gold-hemmed black hood before even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.
She wore this gold-hemmed black cloak before even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.
She wore these gold-lined black gloves before even the Age of Fire, and they offer strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, founder of pyromancy and one of the Daughters of Chaos.
She wore this gold-hemmed black skirt before even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

Head of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.
Without its core, it is a mere hunk of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but its immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

Body of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.
Without its core, it is a mere hunk of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but its immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

Arms of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.
Without its core, they are mere hunks of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but their immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

Legs of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.
Without its core, they are mere hunks of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but their immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

Helm worn by Hollow soldiers. It may be old and battered, but its iron construction makes it quite sturdy.
It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other physical threats.
Armor worn by Hollow soldiers. It may be old and battered, but its iron construction makes it quite sturdy.
Soldier's Gloves
Waistcloth worn by Hollow soldiers. It is so tattered that it barely serves its purpose anymore.

Helm of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.
Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

Armor of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.
Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

Gauntlets of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.
Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

Leggings of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.
Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.
Hood worn by Hollow thieves. Used to hide a guilty countenance.
Leather armor worn by Hollow thieves. It stifles noise and helps its wearer hide in the shadows.
Thief's Gloves
Tights worn by Hollow thieves. They stifle noise and help their wearer hide in the shadows.

Helm worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. It is made from thick iron plates.
Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

Armor worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. It is made from thick iron plates.
Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

Gauntlets worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. They are made from thick iron plates.

Leggings worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. They are made from thick iron plates.
Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

Helm worn by Hollow warriors. Although it is made of iron, it is old, battered and worn out.
It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other physical threats.
Armor worn by Hollow warriors. It is made of thick leather that is tattered with age.
Warrior's Gloves
Waistcloth worn by Hollow warriors. It is so tattered that it barely serves its purpose anymore.

Helm of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.
Made from ancient brass, it also offers protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to its giant size, it is extremely heavy for humans, and impedes stamina recovery.

Armor of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.
Made from ancient brass, it also offers protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to its giant size, it is extremely heavy for humans, and impedes stamina recovery.

Gauntlets of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.

Leggings of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.
Made from ancient brass, they also offer protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to their giant size, they are extremely heavy for humans, and impede stamina recovery.

Crown of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.
This crown of the gods demands faith immeasurable of its wearer, but it is imbued with Darkmoon power that enhances all magic. The image of the sun manifests Gwyndolin's deep adoration of the sun.

Robe of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.
The power of the moon was strong in Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin, and hardly provides any physical defense.

Gloves of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.
The power of the moon was strong in Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin, and hardly provides any physical defense.

Waistcloth of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.
The power of the moon was strong in Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin, and hardly provides any physical defense.

Crown of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.
Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided his power among his great clan before linking the flame. But he did keep his crown, perhaps to preserve a symbol of the monarch, for its actual power had fully subsided.

Robe of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.
Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his clan before linking the flame. When he departed, he left only with his greatsword, his garb, and the crown, now bereft of power.

Bracelets of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.
Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his clan before linking the flame. When he departed, he left only with his greatsword, his garb, and the crown, now bereft of power.

Anklets of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.
Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his clan before linking the flame. When he departed, he left only with his greatsword, his garb, and the crown, now bereft of power.

Bloodstained patchwork sack by the Undead man-eating cook lurking in the Depths. Two eyeholes have been haphazardly cut out.
It is unexpectedly soft and comfortable to wear, but it is probably near meaningless in terms of defense.

Monster head resembling a treasure chest. Once an ancient god, it is said this is the symbol of shame imposed on a long lost clan, exiled for the sin of avarice.
Wearing this slightly raises soul absorption and item discovery, but also affects its wearer with the curse of the branded.

Helm of Vamos, skeleton blacksmith of the Catacombs. Partially made of gold, and confers high resistance overall.
The helm is believed to belong to an ancient royal line, but only Vamos would know for sure, and he shall never speak again.

One of the three masks of the Pinwheel, the necromancer who stole the power of the Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.
This mask, belonging to the valiant father, slightly raises equipment load.

One of the three masks of the Pinwheel, the necromancer who stole the power of the Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.
This mask, belonging to the kindly mother, slightly raises HP.

One of the three masks of the Pinwheel, the necromancer who stole the power of the Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.
This mask, belonging to the naive child, slightly raises stamina recovery speed.

Severed head of the fully-armored Fang Boar taken by the one who killed it as proof of his victory, just as the Gods once did with the head of the ancient dragon.
Can be worn on the head as a surprisingly sound piece of protective gear.

Helm of the gargoyle, an enchanted creature that guarded the Bell of Awakening in the belfry of the Undead Church.
This bronze helm was for mere appearance's sake, as gargoyle skin is naturally hard. Little in the way of defense can be expected from it.

Hat worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School.
They secretly work with sound-based spells, and never reveal themselves.

Helm of an order of fallen knights who disbanded and fled, but met untimely deaths.
The drab, tattered hood conceals tough, black metal which provides dependable protection from fire. It is just possible to make out the majestic gold engravings on its surface.

Armor of an order of fallen knights who disbanded and fled, but met untimely deaths.
The drab, tattered cloth conceals tough, black metal which provides dependable protection from fire. It is just possible to make out the majestic gold engravings on its surface.

Gauntlets of an order of fallen knights who disbanded and fled, but met untimely deaths.
The drab, tattered cloth conceals tough, black metal which provides dependable protection from fire. It is just possible to make out the majestic gold engravings on its surface.

Trousers of an order of fallen knights.
Held beneath leather boots and drab cloth using a knot of rope and bandage, they are indelibly stained with the misery of flight.

Helm of an order of fallen knights who disbanded and fled, but met untimely deaths.
The black metal of the helm provides dependable protection from fire, though missing the tattered cloth hood. It is just possible to make out the majestic gold engravings on its surface.

Armor of an order of fallen knights who disbanded and fled, but met untimely deaths.
The black metal of the armor provides dependable protection from fire, though missing the tattered cloth coat. It is just possible to make out the majestic gold engravings on its surface.

Gauntlets of an order of fallen knights who disbanded and fled, but met untimely deaths.

Trousers of an order of fallen knights.
Held beneath leather boots and drab cloth using a knot of rope and bandage, they are indelibly stained with the misery of flight.

Helm of a lowly knight, fashioned from solid iron.
This iron helm might be on the heftier side compared to others of its ilk, but as such offers great physical absorption in exchange for its imposing weight. Do not think to wear it without the necessary vitality.

Armor of a lowly knight, fashioned from solid iron.
This iron armor might be on the heftier side compared to others of its ilk, but as such offers great physical absorption in exchange for its imposing weight. Do not think to wear it without the necessary vitality.

Gauntlets of a lowly knight, fashioned from solid iron.
These gauntlets might be on the heftier side compared to others of their ilk, but as such offer great physical absorption in exchange for their imposing weight. Do not think to wear it without the necessary vitality.

Leggings of a lowly knight, fashioned from solid iron.
These leggings might be on the heftier side compared to others of their ilk, but as such offer great physical absorption in exchange for their imposing weight. Do not think to wear it without the necessary vitality.

Helm of the Soul of Cinder, a deific manifestation of the Lords of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.
It resembles a knight's helm, but bears hideous burns and contortions. A misshapen crown can be seen upon its rear.
It exists as a symbol of the great Lords and the noble act of linking the fire, though it is no more than an empty husk.

Armor of the Soul of Cinder, a deific manifestation of the Lords of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.
It resembles a knight's armor, but bears hideous burns and contortions, taking the shape of a deathly ribcage.
It exists as a symbol of the great Lords and the noble act of linking the fire, though it is no more than an empty husk.

Gauntlets of the Soul of Cinder, a deific manifestation of the Lords of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.
They resemble a knight's gauntlets, but bear hideous burns and contortions.
They exist as a symbol of the great Lords and the noble act of linking the fire, though they are no more than empty husks.

Leggings of the Soul of Cinder, a deific manifestation of the Lords of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.
They resemble a knight's leggings, but bear hideous burns and contortions. They exist as a symbol of the great Lords and the noble act of linking the fire, though they are no more than empty husks.

Metal helm interwoven with coarse cloth. Able to endure the hardships of battle and prolonged travel.
It is light considering the build, striking a fine balance between absorption and substance.

Metal armor interwoven with coarse cloth. Able to endure the hardships of battle and prolonged travel.
It is light considering the build, striking a fine balance between absorption and substance.

Metal gauntlet interwoven with coarse cloth. Able to endure the hardships of battle and prolonged travel.
Frequent shield users lighten the load by wearing a gauntlet on only one arm.
These cloth trousers and leather boots are of no real note, but are durable and allow for easy movement. Able to endure the hardships of battle and prolonged travel.

Steel helm said to be worn by Heralds of the Way of White, who deliver commandments of duty.
Protection made of steel has excellent physical absorption, but is found lacking against blunt strikes and lightning damage.

Steel armor with a pure white cape, the signature of Heralds of the way of White.
Protection made of steel has excellent physical absorption, but is found lacking against blunt strikes and lightning damage.

Leather gloves said to be worn by Heralds of the way of White, who deliver commandments of duty.
Fairly plain, but made to last on long journeys.

Quilted trousers said to be worn by Heralds of the way of White, who deliver commandments of duty.
The insulated material is effective against strike damage, nicely complementing steel protective wear.

Attire of a knight from the Sunless Realms, known for their resistance to both magic and the dark.
Formed of a silk veil and silver headband.
Sunless Knights serve the nameless moon, and perhaps it is for this reason the attire casts a feminine silhouette.

Attire of a knight from the Sunless Realms, known for their resistance to both magic and the dark.
Metal plating and chainmail, treated with silver.
Sunless Knights serve the nameless moon, and perhaps it is for this reason the attire casts a feminine silhouette.

Attire of a knight from the Sunless Realms, known for their resistance to both magic and the dark.
Iron gauntlets, partially treated with silver.
Sunless Knights serve the nameless moon, and perhaps it is for this reason the attire casts a feminine silhouette.

Attire of a knight from the Sunless Realms, known for their resistance to both magic and the dark. Metal leggings and chainmail, treated with silver.
Sunless Knights serve the nameless moon, and perhaps it is for this reason the attire casts a feminine silhouette.

Attire of hunters known as the King's Black Hands. This wide-brimmed hat is emblematic of the role.
Black Hand was a title established to honor hunters who served successive kings. To date, no more than three such individuals have borne this distinction.

Attire of hunters known as the King's Black Hands. A black cape covers leather armor, shrouding the wearer in darkness.
Black Hand was a title established to honor hunters who served successive generations of kings. To date, no more than three such individuals have borne this distinction.

Soft leather gloves worn by assassins who lurk in the shadows.
The thick leather offers reasonable absorption without creating any undesired noise. A well-crafted piece of protection.

Soft leather trousers worn by assassins who lurk in the shadows.
The thick leather offers reasonable absorption without creating any undesired noise. A well-crafted piece of protection.

Black cloth covering the face of the assassins who lurk in the shadows.
Grants much-needed protection to the head as well as cover from rain while pursuing a target on the road.

Soft leather armor worn by assassins who lurk in the shadows.
The thick leather offers reasonable absorption without creating any undesired noise. A well-crafted piece of protection.
Critical spots are reinforced with metal.

Crown supposedly made in imitation of a divine creature of Oolacile, land of ancient, golden sorceries.
Xanthous clothing is the mark of a researcher of lost sorceries, and the oversized crown is emblematic of their work. Such a curious pursuit is surely nothing to be ashamed of.

Yellowish overcoat covering a band of brass medallions.
Xanthous clothing is the mark of a researcher of lost sorceries, and the number of medallions denotes their success. A point of pride for the researchers, even if its significance is lost on others.

Yellowish gloves.
Xanthous clothing is the mark of a researcher of lost sorceries, and it is said that with golden sorceries, one could manipulate light.

Yellowish trousers.
Xanthous clothing is the mark of a researcher of lost sorceries, and it is said that with golden sorceries, one could manipulate light.

Iron helm of a stalwart northern warrior. Engraved with an ornate pattern.
Iron defensive wear grants superior stability. Being from the north, it should also offer resistance to the cold.

Iron armor of a stalwart northern warrior. Supported by interwoven chainmail.
Iron defensive wear grants superior absorption. Being from the north, it should also offer resistance to the cold.

Gloves of a stalwart northern warrior. Made of thick leather.
In addition to their protection from blunt strikes, they excel at retaining heat, providing good resistance to the cold.

Trousers of a stalwart northern warrior. Thick leather boots lined with fur.
In addition to their protection from blunt strikes, they excel at retaining heat, providing good resistance to the cold.

Ancient helm made for gladiatorial use, crudely put together using metal plates and leather.
Long ago, in the first and only age of men, armor such as this was issued to prizefighters of all backgrounds, shapes and sizes.

Ancient armor made for gladiatorial use, crudely put together using metal plates and leather.

Unusual helm bestowed upon knights of Carim.
Modeled on Morne, the Archbishop's apostle, the helm is of perfect likeness to the stone heads lining the cathedral.
A Carim knight will dedicate an entire career to attending a single maiden, just as Morne once served one goddess alone.

Black armor bestowed upon knights of Carim.
Modeled on Morne, the Archbishop's apostle, cast from a unique mineral resembling stone.
A Carim knight will dedicate an entire career to attending a single maiden, just as Morne once served one goddess alone.

Silver mask of Ringfinger Leonhard.
In his youth, Leonhard suffered grave burns to his entire body. His face in particular, which he hid beneath his mask, was terribly scalded.
He abstained from restoring these injuries, even after becoming a Finger of Rosaria,

Garb of Ringfinger Leonhard.
Leonhard was born into royalty, which is believed to be the reason for his skill in both sorcery and swordsmanship.
Indeed, this dingy garb is in fact embroidered with gold thread, betraying its purpose as military wear designed for a noble.

Gauntlets of Ringfinger Leonhard.
Leonhard was born into royalty, which is believed to be the reason for his skill in both sorcery and swordsmanship.
Indeed, these dingy gauntlets are in fact decorated with silver, betraying their purpose as military wear designed for a noble.

Trousers of Ringfinger Leonhard.
Leonhard was born into royalty, which is believed to be the reason for his skill in both sorcery and swordsmanship.
Indeed, these dingy trousers are in fact meticulously tanned, betraying their purpose as military wear designed for a noble.

Hat of a noble family from Vinheim.
Has excellent straightforward defense, but not nearly enough to allow an ordinary man to stand any chance against a genuine threat.
Students with ambitions that lay outside the guidelines of the Vinheim college are cast into exile, regardless of bloodline and standing.

Garb of a noble family from Vinheim.
A regal piece graced by intricate silverwork, once designed for military use. Perhaps an artifact of the family's position of power.
Students with ambitions that lay outside the guidelines of the Vinheim college are cast into exile, regardless of bloodline and standing.

Gauntlets of a noble family from Vinheim.

Trousers of a noble family from Vinheim.

Attire worn by those who kill in the name of the Sable Church of Londor.

Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp, particularly favored by old sages.

Attire of Cornyx, pyromancer of the Great Swamp.

Attire of Cornyx, pyromancer of the Great Swamp. The bronze ornamentation serves to ward off evil spirits.

Attire of Cornyx, pyromancer of the Great Swamp.
This long skirt emulates those worn by witches, who were the forebears of pyromancy.

Steel helm of Horace the Hushed, who took a liking to its cold, bulky insides.

Horace is one of only two children to escape Aldrich's clutches.

Steel leggings of Horace the Hushed, who took a liking to their cold, bulky insides.
The original owner was said to be a corrupt executioner, who was killed and stripped of his armor.

Attire of the three mentors of the Sable Church of Londor, this princely billed mask belongs to Yuria, the second eldest.
These maidens of a Primordial Serpent were renowned as founders of the Sable Church, which offered salvation for Hollows.

Attire of the three mentors of the Sable Church of Londor, this pitch-black dress resembles a mourning dress.
These maidens of a Primordial Serpent were renowned as founders of the Sable Church, which offered salvation for Hollows.

Attire of the three mentors of the Sable Church of Londor, these black gauntlets are hidden by the dress.

Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Comprised of a leather crown and animal bones.

Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Comprised of bronze ornamentation and animal pelt.
In the Great Swamp, bronze was used ritualistically to ward off evil spirits and keep darkness at bay.
Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Leather wrapped plainly around the arms.

Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Cloth trousers wound tightly with leather, and fitted with dermis split-toe shoes.
The life of a pyromancer is a life of endless trudging through marshland.

Hood worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital.
This tall, dark headpiece suggests they may have also been oracles.
There are many sorcerers who claim to heirship to the great sage "Big Hat" Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses one of two leading schools.

Robe worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital.

There are many sorcerers who claim heirship to the great sage "Big Hat" Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses one of two leading schools.

Attire of a sorcerer from the Vinheim Dragon School. Long, ash-colored robes.

Iron mask of the watchdogs of Farron's Keep.

Both the exiles were surely watchdogs themselves, for Farron has always been a land of itinerants.

Made of a most common material, iron. The craftsmanship of this hat seems as if from another a faraway land.

The head of an abominable being from the East.
Tainted by a curse, any who venture to wear the mask will lose any semblance of reason or will. Mangy red hair engulfs the bony face of this fiend, and consumes its wearer with insurmountable rage until they are reduced to a creature of hatred.

Resembles the mask of plague doctors.
Plague doctors keep aromatic items in the beak of the mask as it's thought to ward off infection. The doctors believe scent is one of the mechanisms of transmission of the plague.

A strange helmet made of iron.
Two golden horns sprout from the top of this helm as if to imitate a reindeer.
The previous wearer once was feared for their proficiency in mounted combat.
Only, if they have parted with this helm, perhaps that proficiency may have been overstated.

A strange mask unlike any find in this land.
This mask bears the visage of an obviously evil being, although as to which is unclear.
Perhaps our ignorance of such a being is for the better.

A woven straw hat from the East with a flat top with the tip held in a tail by a string.
It covers most of the face and is designed with multiple slits, thereby allowing a wanderer to mask his identity and travel undistracted by sights around him on his journey.
Since this type of hat is worn by those who are exiled from the eastern realms, it is only appropriate to see the hat covering the person’s face. This is to uphold their dignity, that no one may lay eyes upon the face of an exiled man.

A strange mask depicting a man's face.
The mask is painted black and expresses anger.

A strange helmet made of metal.
The golden attributes of this headpiece speak to the status of someone who would've worn it.

A strange mask depicting an expressionless face in white.
It seems whoever created this mask did not want his expression shown to others.
Even though it tries to hide the expression of the one who wears it, the mask seems somehow sad.

Leather hat that fully covers the eye area, likely out of some symbolic meaning.
Perhaps whoever wore such clothing had some function as a priest or healer.
Only, one can imagine the dangers that come with trying to operate on a patient while donning such a visually impairing piece of headwear.

Set of formal white robes.
The white color of this attire leads one to think that perhaps whoever wore this garb had some function as a priest or healer.

Set of formal white gloves.
The white color of this attire leads one to think that perhaps whoever wore this garb had some function as a priest or healer.

Set of formal white boots.
The white color of this attire leads one to think that perhaps whoever wore this garb had some function as a priest or healer.

Helmet of heavy dark iron.
A freezing sensation overcomes anyone who wears this armor; the black iron traps all body heat and the user breathes out cold air.

Armor of heavy dark iron.
A freezing sensation overcomes anyone who wears this armor; the black iron traps all body heat and the user breathes out cold air.

Gauntlets of heavy dark iron.
A freezing sensation overcomes anyone who wears this armor; the black iron traps all body heat and the user breathes out cold air.

Leggings of heavy dark iron.
A freezing sensation overcomes anyone who wears this armor; the black iron traps all body heat and the user breathes out cold air.

An enigmatic cone of cloth.
Albeit similar in appearance to the headpieces of the Xanthous Scholars, it does not seem to have any relation to it.
Perhaps it could be worn in a similar fashion.
A filthy sack unfit for any use as clothing. It stinks with a vile odor.

Helm of a hulking knight, ordered to hunt down those who bear the undead curse.
It has since been forgotten who put the pursuers on their mission and it is unclear whether they still roam the lands.

A brutish, hulking mass of armor.
It bore the mission of indomitable knights who relentlessly pursued bearers of the undead curse, even beyond death. Within the metal, the engraved faces of his screaming victims thrash in anguish, as if to escape. The discovery of this armor is curious indeed, and it is unclear whether these pursuers still roam the land or one’s calling for atonement led him down a different path.

A brutish, hulking mass of armor.
It bore the mission of indomitable knights who relentlessly pursued bearers of the undead curse, even beyond death. Within the metal, the engraved faces of his screaming victims thrash in anguish, as if to escape. The discovery of this armor is curious indeed, and it is unclear whether these pursuers still roam the land or one’s calling for atonement led him down a different path.

A brutish, hulking mass of armor.
It bore the mission of indomitable knights who relentlessly pursued bearers of the undead curse, even beyond death. Within the metal, the engraved faces of his screaming victims thrash in anguish, as if to escape. The discovery of this armor is curious indeed, and it is unclear whether these pursuers still roam the land or one’s calling for atonement led him down a different path.

Helm of the Corvian Knights of Ariandel.
This rare helmet is made to fit the twisted facial structure of a crow-like being with a long and sharp beak.
The corvians who live within the painting wish for nothing but peace in their gentle haven, but some decided to take up arms, determined to defend their cold home from an inevitable fate.

Helmet fashioned from the head of a giant crab.
Only the most insane of fools would use this abomination as headgear.
Even if very crude, it provides decent protection against physical attacks.

Crown of the Furtive Pygmy, bearer of the Dark Soul.
Using this soul, he fragmented it, fathering humanity.
After the end of the war against the everlasting dragons, the First Lord granted humanity the Ringed City as a place to call home.
This crown is a symbol of humanity itself. Those who bear it are paragons of human-kind, and therefore darkness.

Crown of Filianore, youngest daughter of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder.
As the Matriarch of the Church of Londor, Filianore ruled over the Ringed City. But now she lays dormant with no signs of awakening. If someone were to wake her, however, no one knows what doom they would call upon themselves.

A hooded mask with a beak worn by priests.
Priests believed these masks would protect them from vile fumes when embarking on missions during plagues as healers.
The insides of these mask's beaks would usually be stuffed with flowers to prevent the priest from breathing air filled with miasma.

An atypical mask worn by Lothric soldiers.
Used more broadly during Lothric's era of dragon hunting, this helmet has become somewhat rare in current times.
The hinge attaching the faceplate to the helm seems to have been melted shut, restraining the user from lifting it, but also providing sound defense.

A strange mask depicting the visage of an old man.
The expression of this old man oozes anger, or perhaps concern.
His beard is long and white, fit for an elderly war hero.

A wooden barrel with no lid and a faint aroma of wine.
Even in the hardest of times, a fool can always scrape the bottom of the barrel for some ill-suited courage.

Brilliant metal cone that might be mistaken for some kind of ornament or decoration.
Upon closer inspection it seems there is an opening at the bottom of this object, one shaped as if to fit a human head.
Practical matters, such as descending ladders or being able to see, are not of relevance to the sort of people that wear such a curious helmet.

A hexagonal iron cage.
Uncomfortable and impractical, this cage is worn by madmen, granting them the insight to see the profane world for what it is.

One of the three masks of a necromancer from ages passed.
Its vigor strengthening property made it the desire of many undead, but its lustre has faded with the years.

One of the three masks of a necromancer from ages passed.
Once the subject of a humorous tale, the joke appears to have worn thin over the years.
One of the three masks of a necromancer from ages passed.

The crown of Sulyvahn, Pontiff of Irithyll. Fashioned after branches of a birch tree.
The sorcerer bestowed this golden crown upon himself. He asserted his control over the moonlit city, shrouding the Boreal Valley in a misty cold air. A familiarity from his home.

Attire of Sulyvahn, Pontiff of Irithyll. A worn-out robe adorned with jewelry and gold, signifying his status as the ruler of the old city.
Sulyvahn long had his eye on the title of Pontiff, a stepping stone to fulfill his burning ambition.
Closely resembling one of a sorcerer, the attire alludes to Sulyvahn's true nature.

Golden bracelets adorned with jewelry
The sorcerer gifted himself this pair of bracelets. He asserted his control over the moonlit city, shrouding the Boreal Valley in a misty cold air. A familiarity from his home.

A worn-out skirt adorned with jewelry and gold, signifying his status as the ruler of the old city.
Sulyvahn long had his eye on the title of Pontiff, a stepping stone to fulfill his burning ambition.
Closely resembling one of a sorcerer, the attire alludes to Sulyvahn's true nature.

Iron mask worn by Heide Knights.
Whether Heide refers to a kingdom or was just a name for the land is not clear, for no records date back far enough to tell.
All that is known is that the Way of the Blue has its origins in Heide, and that Heide was later subsumed by the sea.

Massive iron helm worn by royal guards serving the Consumed King of Lothric.
As the King retreated to the royal garden, spending his later years in solitude, his loyal knights remained by his side. With the ample might, the knights are sworn to wall off the secluded garden from foolish intruders.
But some say they are meant to contain the terror within.

Massive iron armor worn by royal guards serving the Consumed King of Lothric.
As the King retreated to the royal garden, spending his later years in solitude, his loyal knights remained by his side. With the ample might, the knights are sworn to wall off the secluded garden from foolish intruders.
But some say they are meant to contain the terror within.

Massive iron gauntlets worn by royal guards serving the Consumed King of Lothric.
As the King retreated to the royal garden, spending his later years in solitude, his loyal knights remained by his side. With the ample might, the knights are sworn to wall off the secluded garden from foolish intruders.
But some say they are meant to contain the terror within.

Massive iron leggings worn by royal guards serving the Consumed King of Lothric.
As the King retreated to the royal garden, spending his later years in solitude, his loyal knights remained by his side. With the ample might, the knights are sworn to wall off the secluded garden from foolish intruders.
But some say they are meant to contain the terror within.

Armor of an Lothric knight. A strong steel helm, if a little worn.
The Knight has served as one of the Three Pillars since ancient times, and shares place alongside the wyverns as a symbol of Lothric.
Only those possessing a knight's resolve are fit to wear this garment.

Armor of an elite Lothric knight. The coat of distinction is all but fallen apart.
The Knight has served as one of the Three Pillars since ancient times, and shares place alongside the wyverns as a symbol of Lothric.
Only those possessing a knight's resolve are fit to wear this garment.

Armor of an elite Lothric knight. Strong steel gauntlets, if a little scratched.
The Knight has served as one of the Three Pillars since ancient times, and shares place alongside the wyverns as a symbol of Lothric.
Only those possessing a knight's resolve are fit to wear this garment.

Armor of a celebrated Lothric knight. Strong steel leggings, if a little scratched.
The Knight has served as one of the Three Pillars since ancient times, and shares place alongside the wyverns as a symbol of Lothric.
Only those possessing a knight's resolve are fit to wear this garment.

Helm of the Gertrude's Knights, who stand guarding an isolated cell of the Grand Archives.
This armor, plated in gold, shines most brilliantly under the divine light they embraced. Despite the imprisonment of the Heavenly Daughter, her record of the divine messengers continues to inspire the Angelic faith, as demonstrated by these winged knights who are beyond any ordinary man.

Armor of the Gertrude's Knights, who stand guarding an isolated cell of the Grand Archives.
This armor, plated in gold, shines most brilliantly under the divine light they embraced. Despite the imprisonment of the Heavenly Daughter, her record of the divine messengers continues to inspire the Angelic faith, as demonstrated by these winged knights who are beyond any ordinary man.

Gauntlets of the Gertrude's Knights, who stand guarding an isolated cell of the Grand Archives.

Leggings of the Gertrude's Knights, who stand guarding an isolated cell of the Grand Archives.
This armor, plated in gold, shines most brilliantly under the divine light they embraced. Despite the imprisonment of the Heavenly Daughter, her record of the divine messengers continues to inspire the Angelic faith, as demonstrated by these winged knights who are beyond any ordinary man.

Mask worn by the handmaids of the Profaned Capital.
Aristocrats take delight in its plump features.
The handmaids are among the few survivors inhabiting the devastated capital, the coven serves as both keepers and sentinels to the source of their home's destruction. The Profaned Flame seeks human flesh, yet does not harm its caretakers. What sort of being does this mask conceal?

Robe worn by the handmaids of the Profaned Capital.
Originally ritualistic formal wear.
The handmaids are among the few survivors inhabiting the devastated capital, the coven serves as both keepers and sentinels to the source of their home's destruction. The Profaned Flame seeks human flesh, yet does not harm its caretakers. What sort of being is underneath this layered robe?

Robe worn by faithful deacons of Aldrich.
The deep blue pigment denotes the upcoming age of the deep sea. Those who share Aldrich's appetite, share the common dream of their master.
Led by McDonnel, these deacons travel alongside the Devourer, carving his path toward the old city of gods.

Skirt worn by faithful deacons of Aldrich, worn on the inside of the deep blue robe.
Those who share Aldrich's appetite, share the common dream of their master.
Led by McDonnel, these deacons travel alongside the Devourer, carving his path toward the old city of gods.

Decorated armor belonged to a wandering warrior. A solid iron helm crested with a bright red plume.
It is daubed with red threads that symbolize the blood of his people.

Decorated armor belonged to a wandering warrior.
It is daubed with red threads that symbolize the blood of his people.

Decorated armor belonged to a wandering warrior.
It is daubed with red threads that symbolize the blood of his people.

Decorated armor belonged to a wandering warrior.
It is daubed with red threads that symbolize the blood of his people.

Cowl of the Forlorn, who wander the land of the Undead.
The Forlorn lost both their corporeal form and a world to call their own. Now they drift into other worlds, ever in search of a home.
But without self, one has neither beginning nor end, and so the Forlorn have only to wander.

The old king's crown is said to reveal illusions, and expose a mirage that hides a secret.
A king once donned the crown of his own volition, determined to prevent a single soul from stumbling upon the vile secret. What visions did he see, sitting serenely upon his new throne?

Bronzed helm rusted over with soot and dust. The inside is filled to the brim with wet soil.
Belonged to a loyal keeper of the cemetery from ages past, who watches from the grave after death.

Bronzed armor rusted over with soot and dust. Belonged to the loyal keeper of the cemetery from ages past.
Upon his back, a large coffin rattles with the charred bones of his daughter. He tends to her as he wanders from grave to grave.

Bronzed gauntlets rusted over with soot and dust.
Belonged to a loyal keeper of the cemetery from ages past, who watches from the grave after death.

Bronzed leggings rusted over with soot and dust.
Belonged to a loyal keeper of the cemetery from ages past, who watches from the grave after death.

Wide-brimmed hat that belonged to the Archive Sage, one of the twin Crystal Sages.
The Pair are said to be successors to the great sage Logan, and this big hat is a symbol of their pedigree.

Winged armor of the Gertrude's Knights, who stand guarding an isolated cell of the Grand Archives.
This armor, plated in gold, shines most brilliantly under the divine light they embraced. Despite being considered unorthodox, the pair of feathery wings, as described in Gertrude's tale, proves the authenticity of the Angelic faith.

Cowl of the High Priestess. Ever vigilant, she peers beneath its hood with beady eyes.
In Lothric, she served as the prince's wet nurse and one of the Three Pillars of the king's rule.

Garb of the High Priestess.
She remains vigilant as the prince's wet nurse and one of the Three Pillars of the king's rule.

Formal hat often adorning noblemen and preachers.
For the people who wore this hat, a keen fascination with beauty and denouncing brutality was commonplace.
More often than not, the men and women donning this hat were the ones most brutish, largely directing their incessant malice towards workers and servants below.

Crown of the old king who protected the Frigid Valley's capital.
Much like its owner, this once glorious garment has suffered greatly from the encroachment of dark.

Robe of the old king who protected the Frigid Valley's capital.
Much like its owner, this once glorious garment has suffered greatly from the encroachment of dark.

White crown worn by an Archdeacon of the Cathedral of the Deep. Presented solely to delegates of the gods.
Of the three Archdeacons of the Deep, one cast off his white crown and left the cathedral to stand by Aldrich.

Holy garb worn by an Archdeacon of the Cathedral of the Deep. A sign of the Way of White's highest rank.
Of the three Archdeacons of the Deep, one stood over Aldrich's casket, with hope that he would return one day.
%null%

Skirt worn by an Archdeacon of the Cathedral of the Deep. Worn underneath holy garb.
Of the Archdeacons of the Deep, one attended to Rosaria, Mother of Rebirth, whom he deemed a goddess.
%null%

Robe worn by deacons of the Cathedral of the Deep. The deep red pigment denotes the blessing of fire.
In time, those dedicated to sealing away the horrors of the Deep succumbed to their very power. It seems that neither tending to the flame, nor the faith, could save them.

Mask worn by the beast knight of the Frigid Valley.
The mask was created using techniques now lost. It clearly has an unusual, unsettling air about it.

Blindfold worn by the guardian of the shrine.
The Fire Keepers were robbed of light, to better serve as vessels for souls. Only those who cherish the writhing, searing darkness were given the keepers' silver crown.
The complex design is exquisitely crafted, carrying a faint resemblance to that of the first maiden to tend to the flames.

Robe worn by the guardian of the shrine.

Chainmail helm of thin interlinking rings of steel. Popular due to its ease of crafting, respectable damage absorption, and light weight.
Knights may favor imposing armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, that which keeps them alive is armor enough.

Gloves made of soft leather. A common form of protection.

Helm said to have been given to elite knights of fallen Astora.
The mere mention of Astora invokes wistful pangs, and perhaps it was such a dream that drew Anri to this faraway home known only by name.

Often ridiculed for its onion-like shape, infuriating the country's proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for deflecting blows.

Armor as if hewn from a giant boulder. Highly protective, but excessively heavy.
The warriors who followed Havel the Rock never flinched, nor retreated from battle, crushing any foe that stood in their way.

Hood from a foreign land. Probably belonged to a brigand who met his match.

Broad-brimmed leather hat. Traditionally used by master archers, and especially favored by forest-dwelling hunters.

Armor made of smooth leather. Even lighter and more flexible than most leather armors.
Gloves made of smooth leather. Even lighter and more flexible than most leather armors.

Rag that covers the wearer's mouth.
Likely a makeshift item that helped reduce intake of various poisonous and noxious fumes.

A terribly worn shirt.
Men are fond of weaving tales to explain the raggedness of their garb.
"My sixth sense warned me of danger, and I danced between flurries of blades, unscathed, but alas, my clothes went to tatters."

Traditional attire worn by sorcerers of the Vinheim Dragon School.

Helmet of an indentured knight from a far-off land mired in heretics and cultists.
The stout helmet provides solid defense, but leaves the wearer almost devoid of their senses.
Donning the helmet, faint mutterings of ritualistic prayer can occasionally be heard. Straining to listen only serves to make the whispers grow quiet.

The sturdy plating easily shrugs off physical attacks, seemingly as solid as rock.
Tattered remnants of an insignia adorn the metal. Such metalworking is rarely seen in the lands of Lothric, even among the elites. While stout, small openings are required to let the armor move freely. These openings allow quick thrusting weapons to pierce the flesh underneath.
The armor sometimes shifts, seemingly of its own accord, oftentimes feeling as if there is another marionetting the plates of steel.

Solid gauntlets that fit like a second skin. They grip with an otherworldly strength.
Thin scratches and scuffs from battles past scar the metal. But the palms seem to be without imperfections, as if the previous wearer held another form of protection while swinging their weapon.

The linen inside the boots is dry, yet with every step the sodden earth seeps through the boots.
The soles are heavily worn, indicating the previous wearer's long and arduous journey.

In another realm, the Fume Knight served a mighty king, but was bested in combat by a fellow paladin and branded a traitor.
His resolve failing him, he discovered new purpose in a distant kingdom, where he offered his servitude to not a regal father, but a gentle mother.

Armor worn by the Fume Knight, the raven engraved on the torso holds its wings aloft. Is this in an amiicable greeting? Or perhaps a stark warning?
The Fume Knight has made a home of the old kingdom, finding comfort and purpose in the ash that drifts from its towers. Unknown to him, he served a daughter of the Abyss, and the lifestyle she provided for the Fume Knight was one of gentle warmth and dire shadow. Maybe her vassal was aware of this.

The Forlorn lost both their corporeal form and a world to call their own. Now they drift into other worlds, ever in search of a home.
But without self, one has neither beginning nor end, and so the forlorn have only to wander. Only, the Forlorn have not been seen in a long time. Perhaps their search ended, and they found what they wanted.

A fine piece of attire that provides minimal defense; made distinct from modern coats due to the high collar and numerous leather belts.

Peculiar gloves of foreign origin.
